risk_points: 金融资产公允价值计量存在模型依赖与市场风险敞口
特定资产类别（抵押贷款和资产支持证券）的信用风险需关注
evidence: 输入内容指出：持有大量金融资产（公允价值1324亿美元），其中Level 2工具占比高（980亿美元）。其估值依赖模型和可观察市场数据输入。
输入内容指出：需关注在利率或市场波动下，这些资产的公允价值计量是否合理，特别是抵押贷款和资产支持证券（230亿美元）的信用风险。

外部检索摘要中的10-K文件摘要指出：Apple operates in highly competitive global markets characterized by rapid technological advancements and price sensitivity. Key market segments include consumer electronics, cloud services, digital content distribution, payment services, and subscription-based services.
背景要点指出主要风险包括：Financial: Net sales and gross margins are subject to volatility and downward pressure from industry pricing pressures, competition, and demand stimulation challenges.
reasoning_summary: 基于输入内容，Apple Inc.持有规模庞大的金融资产（1324亿美元），其中绝大部分（980亿美元）为Level 2公允价值计量工具，其估值依赖于模型和可观察市场数据输入。这构成了一个固有的会计与财务报告风险领域，因为模型输入和假设的变动可能显著影响资产账面价值。特别指出，其中230亿美元的抵押贷款和资产支持证券面临信用风险，在利率或市场波动环境下，其估值合理性需要审慎评估。然而，当前提供的证据（输入内容、外部检索摘要、背景要点）均未包含关于这些金融资产的具体构成、估值模型细节、关键输入参数、敏感性分析或近期公允价值变动的详细信息。外部检索摘要和背景要点主要描述了公司的运营风险（如市场竞争、定价压力），但未直接涉及金融资产计量的具体会计政策或近期表现。因此，无法基于现有证据判断是否存在高风险的会计操纵或计量错误，但该特征本身因涉及重大金额和主观判断而值得进一步核查。
suggestions: 核查Apple Inc.最新年度报告（10-K）中关于金融工具的附注，特别是公允价值计量层级（Level 1, 2, 3）的详细分类、各类资产的金额、估值技术及关键输入值。
获取并分析关于抵押贷款和资产支持证券（230亿美元）的信用质量信息，如信用评级分布、逾期情况、预期信用损失模型参数等。
审查管理层讨论与分析（MD&A）中关于市场风险（利率风险、信用风险）的定量和定性披露，以及这些风险对金融资产公允价值的影响。
评估审计报告中关于金融资产公允价值计量的关键审计事项（如适用）及相关审计应对措施。

_external_search.title: Apple Full Year 2025 Report
_external_search.content: Though Apple hasn’t issued fiscal 2026 guidance, it expects revenue growth from strong iPhone and Services demand and new product launches. GUIDANCE CEO’s Commentary Apple delivered a September quarter revenue record of $102.5 billion, driven by record iPhone and Services performance, said Tim Cook, CEO. Margin and Efficiency Analysis MILLION USD Q4 2025 ESTIMATE BEAT/MISS REVENUE 102.00B 102.00B 0.20% EBITDA 35.30B 34.70B 1.70% EBIT 32.40B 31.70B 2.40% EPS 1.85 1.77 4.50% Expectation Analysis Performance Highlights Apple achieved record fiscal 2025 revenue of $416.2 billion, up 6% YoY, driven by robust iPhone and Services sales. iPhone revenue rose 4% to $209.6 billion, led by strong demand for premium iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max models. Gross margin (46.91%) remained solid, supported by favorable product mix and operational efficiency, while operating margin (32.27%) and net income margin (27.21%) improved year-over-year, underscoring disciplined cost management and revenue leverage.

_external_search.title: APPLE INC 10-K Filing FY25
_external_search.content: APPLE INC 10-K Filing FY25. # APPLE INC. - Apple Inc. designs and develops a wide range of products and services, including hardware such as smartphones, personal computers, tablets, and wearables, as well as software solutions, cloud services, and digital content offerings. Apple also provides payment services through products like Apple Card and Apple Pay. - Apple operates in highly competitive global markets characterized by rapid technological advancements and price sensitivity. Key market segments include consumer electronics, cloud services, digital content distribution, payment services, and subscription-based services. - Apple's competitive advantages stem from its significant portfolio of patents and intellectual property, offering a unique integration of hardware and software solutions. - Apple focuses on continuous innovation and the integration of new technologies into its product offerings, backed by significant investments in research and development. - Apple relies on various key suppliers and outsourcing partners for manufacturing and logistics, particularly in regions like China, India, and Taiwan.

_external_search.title: Apple Revenue 2012-2025 | AAPL
_external_search.content: ## Apple Revenue 2012-2025 | AAPL. Apple annual/quarterly revenue history and growth rate from 2012 to 2025. * Apple revenue for the quarter ending December 31, 2025 was **$143.756B**, a **15.65% increase** year-over-year. * Apple revenue for the twelve months ending December 31, 2025 was **$435.617B**, a **10.07% increase** year-over-year. * Apple annual revenue for 2025 was **$416.161B**, a **6.43% increase** from 2024. * Apple annual revenue for 2024 was **$391.035B**, a **2.02% increase** from 2023. * Apple annual revenue for 2023 was **$383.285B**, a **2.8% decline** from 2022. | Apple Annual Revenue (Millions of US $) |. | Apple Quarterly Revenue (Millions of US $) |. | Sector | Industry | Market Cap | Revenue |. Moreover, non-iPhone devices like Apple Watch and AirPod have gained significant traction. In fact, Apple dominates the Wearables and Hearables markets due to the growing adoption of Watch and AirPods. **Register to Continue Using Macrotrends**.
